Name of faculty: Science Department: Microbiology
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         Program: B.Sc. Microbiology Sem 6             Type: DSC-11
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             Subject: Microbial Technology                      NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           Credit: 04 + 02 Total learning hours: 60
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Course description: The major objective of this course is to acquaint students with the\rvariousaspects ofindustrial microbiology,differenttypesoffermentation processes,\rfermenters designs and operations. Students will become familiar with mass scale culturing of\rmicroorganisms forindustrial production of various biomolecules and /metabolites of\rindustrial interest and different recovery methods in detail.                      NaN
Student learning outcome:\rStudent will understand the development and importance of industrial microbiology\rand will be conversant with different types of fermentation processes.\rStudent will learn about the design, operation and uses of different types of fermenters\rof laboratory, pilot and industrial scale.\rStudent will gain insight into the techniques of isolation, screening, preservation and\rmaintenance of industrially important microbial strains and different types of media\rused in fermentation processes.\rStudent will have gained in-depth knowledge of the principles of microbial production\rand recovery of industrial products at large scale.                      NaN

Name of faculty: Sciences. Department: Microbiology
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             Program: B.Sc. Microbiology Sem 6             Type: DSC-12
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Subject: Health and Epidemiology                      NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               Credit: 04 + 02 Total learning hours: 60
Course description:\rThe paper contains the topics related to human health. It includes the understanding for\rmicrobial diseases. The subject includes the diseases caused by bacteria, viruses, fungi and\rprotists. Another major learning is Introduction to Epidemiology and hospital acquired\rinfections. It also consist the control and Prevention of Hospital-Associated Infections.                      NaN
                                                                              Student learning outcome:\r●To make them aware about the microbial diseases and its Pathogenicity\r●They will learn about the various diseases caused by bacteria, viruses, fungi and\rprotists.\r●Students will learn about the various Hospital-Associated Infections and get a\roverview of the Epidemiology.                      NaN

Course Code                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Unnamed: 0
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               Course Title                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Essential skills of Computers
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     Credit                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             4
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Teaching per Week                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         4 Hrs
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Minimum weeks per\rSemester                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            12
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     Last Review / Revision                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             -
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Purpose of Course                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           This course is enhance the fundamentals of computer, office\rautomation , database management and internet facility
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           Course Objective                                                                   Introduce the fundamentals of computing devices and reinforce computer\rvocabulary, particularly with respect to personal use of computer\rhardware and software, the Internet. Provide hands-on use of Office\rapplications Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Introduce the database concept\rwith SQL in Access
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               Pr-requisite                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            --
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Course Out come Students will be able to\r Understand concepts of computer component\rManage the documents, presentation and gain practical exposure on\rspreadsheet using office tool.\r Create and manage database using database tool.\r Use SQL statements to store, modify and retrieve data from tables\r gain skills & knowledge to browse and get updated worldwide\rinformation
Course Content\rUnit 1:Introduction of Computers(Duration: 06 Hrs)\r1.1 Evolution of computers ,Classification of Computers and components of computer\r1.2.Fundamentals of Computers\r1.2.1.Software\r1.2.2. Hardware\r1.2.3 Data and User\r1.3Essential Computer Hardware\r1.3.1 Processing device\r1.3.2 Memory device-RAM & ROM\r1.3.3 Input and Output devices\r1.3.4 Storage device-Optical & Magnetic\r1.4. Operating System\rUnit 2: Operate the Computer System(Duration: 04 Hrs)\r2.1. Start Menu                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           NaN

Name of Faculty: Science Department: Biotechnlogy
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       Program: B.Sc. Sem 6              Type: DSE-6
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Subject: Recombinant DNA Technology                      NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Credit: 02 Total learning hours: 30
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Course description: The objectives of this course are to provide students with the theory and\rpractical experience of the use of Recombinant DNA technology which facilitate investigation of\rmolecular biology and evolution-related concepts.                      NaN
Student learning outcome:\r●Students will develop an understanding on basic idea of gene cloning, its importance, types\rof enzymes used as tools in gene cloning as being prime players.\r●As being carriers of genes of interest, students will understand about different types of\rvectors and comparative advantages offered by each of them so that proper choice of\rvector can be done.\r●Students will gain knowledge about techniques to insert prepared clones into different\rorganisms and identification of recombinants.\r●The unit focuses on and thus provides knowledge of different techniques to, first, identify\rand then further validation of recombinants.\r●At the end of the course, the students will have sufficient scientific understanding of the\rsubject and have good knowledge of application of Recombinant DNA techniques in Life\rSciences Research.                      NaN
